Message.Title: What a 13 year POS this stock is
Message.Msg: M Dell laughing at long time bagholders

Topic.Title: What a 13 year POS this stock is

Message.Msg: I do not think M Dell is laughing at you. Yet he is the problem. When he was growing the company he worked endless hours to continue beating expectations and creating stock splits. Now he has his mega millions and still makes very good money with pay and stock options. He is just not motivated and does need to grow the company like he did before. As a result it is a trading stock for brokerages and a stock option for executives in the company. For those that buy it as an investment it is a tax loss. Would not be surprised to see it make a new 52 week low today. Shorts having a field day again.

Topic.Title: What a 13 year POS this stock is

Message.Msg: Wow that didn't take long.It was 11.49 and the I look a few minutes later and it is 11.39. Now 11.39 is the new 52 week low. For Dell at 11.50 a 40 cent drop on a none news is quite a bit.

Message.Title: Dell is dead. Here's why
Message.Msg: 1. smart phones and tablets will make the pc less important. Dell will not be as strong a player in smart phone/tablet market as it was in the pc market. 2. Lenovo, asus, acer, toshiba and other low cost manufacturers are taking market share from dell and lowering profit margins for all the players. 3. Businesses will move to the cloud. The cloud will run on no-name, low cost, disposable servers. If a server malfunctions, throw it away and pop in a new one.

Message.Title: Greenlight capital fund exited dell position
Message.Msg: Greenlight's Einhorn says fund exited Best Buy, Dell in 2nd qtr http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/24/einhorn-greenlight-idUSL2E8IO76U20120724 Looks like greenlight capital made a smart move.

Topic.Title: What a 13 year POS this stock is

Message.Msg: Michael did not earn his success all by himself. A host of men and women helped him along the way, sacrificing in order to produce quality products and implementing systems/processes that were innovative and second to none. Then the scavengers swoop in, under the guise of "we're from XXX and we can manage this better", drinking from the option pool without the same sacrifice as the earlier employees had done. These carpetbaggers didn't possess the same pride in quality products and financial/operations execution. Now you have the self-annointed overhyped experts from P&G and GE... obviously stellar contributions as we tank..

Message.Title: Dell is Not Dead.
Message.Msg: It is not dead yet, it is dying. Slow as a tree. Every day, the Dell tree loses more leaves.
